page.title: 06Northdowm Farm 2
page.content: The milk given by the cows has to be kept below 4 degrees Celsius otherwise the dairy would not buy it.The milk is stored in a jar before being cleaned and collected by the dairy from where it can go to any part of the country. The farm has one bull,which is three years old.All the young male calves are sold at the market.The Galloway bull is black and very large. The cattle are not the only animals on the farm.There are 10 ducks,often to be seen on the village pond and 10 chickens.The hens are 5 months old and eat 6 ounces of grain a day. Abigail Ellis Jonathan Caulfield Paul Moxham
